sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: US President Joe Biden and Russian leader Vladimir Putin exchange warnings over mounting tensions on the border with Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Authorities urge people to limit their New Year celebrations as COVID-19 infections continue to soar across Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: France experiences its warmest winter yet with the mild weather leading to many ski cancellations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: US President Joe Biden has warned Russian leader Vladimir Putin that Washington could impose new sanctions on Moscow if it launches military action against Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: President Putin said further sanctions would signal the end of all ties between the two countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The two leaders held a 50-minute phone call on Thursday, their second this month, over concerns about Russia's military build-up on the border with Ukraine. Putin's foreign adviser Yuri Yushchenkov spoke to journalists after the call.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He said President Putin told Mr Biden that Russia would act as the US would act if offensive weapons were deployed near American borders. He also warned that any further large-scale sanctions in economic, financial or military areas would be a colossal mistake, entailing grave consequences. The White House released a statement saying Biden had urged Russia to de-escalate tensions with Ukraine and called for a diplomatic response to the situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: U.S. intelligence earlier this month said Russia was planning a possible military offensive against Ukraine, a claim Moscow has denied.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But Putin says he wants a commitment that Ukraine will never be allowed to join NATO.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Europe is once again preparing for New Year's Eve celebrations under the cloud of the COVID-19 pandemic. France has seen an explosion of new infections and a number of new health measures come into effect today, including the mandatory wearing of masks in public in many major cities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But this Paris resident says his New Year's Eve won't be affected as he'll be seeing friends.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: However, he is worried about his studies and having to go back to distance learning at school.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He says he suffered from depression during the last period of restrictions and is hoping that this year he'll be less affected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In England, the health service is building temporary structures at hospitals to prepare for a possible surge of COVID-19 patients after a record number of new infections fuelled by the Omicron variant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: New cases in Italy are also surging, reaching more than 126,000 on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But people hoping to be tested faced long queues fuelled by supply shortages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: queues fueled by supply shortages. What I find shocking, this Rome resident says, is that most people are here not because they've had contact with somebody positive, but because of New Year's Eve and they want to go and party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In Germany, authorities have urged people to be cautious during the celebrations and large New Year's events have been cancelled. The sale of fireworks has also been banned after a surge in new infections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And while new cases have hit a tenth daily record in Spain, hundreds of people in Barcelona protested against new restrictions on Thursday, holding an improvised street party without people wearing face masks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's the end of an era as Germany's nuclear phase-out enters its penultimate phase.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Three nuclear power plants will be taken off the grid on December 31st.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Symbolically one of them is the Brockdorf nuclear power plant which became a target of protests by opposition to nuclear power in the 1980s.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: At midnight on New Year's Eve it shut down, much to its overseers disdain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The last few days have been accompanied by a fair amount of melancholy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We have operated the plant for 35 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We looked after it, we kept it at the best technical level and we always operated it safely.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: No trace of melancholy is felt by Carsten Hinrichsen, a long-time anti-nuclear activist, also known as the Brockdorf rebel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I'm quietly but steadily rejoicing that the thing is now shut down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This is not euphoria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Some people ask me if this is a victory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: No, it's not. It's taken far too long for that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In 2011, the then Christian Democrat government under Angela Merkel reversed the decision to extend Germany's usage of nuclear plants, after the Fukushima disaster in Japan earlier that year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The eight oldest reactors were shut down immediately, with the remaining nine to follow in stages until 2022. After Brockdorf, five plants still remain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Grand, Emsland, Gundremingen, Isar and Neckar-Weschtain will go offline by the end of next year, completing the 11-year phase-out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Germany is firmly resisting attempts by the EU Commission to classify nuclear energy as a sustainable technology.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It is also fine-tuning the expansion of renewable energies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: By 2030, 80% of the country's electricity is to come from wind turbines, solar panels or biogas plants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Bordeaux residents are making the most of the good weather as France experiences the warmest winter in its history. That's according to the forecast of Meteo France, with temperatures 10 degrees warmer than average in some regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This man is enjoying the good weather and says that it's nice to be out and about.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: No complaints though, especially not from restauranteurs who are delighted with the extra bit of footfall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's been a beautiful week, this man says, and despite all that's going on, people are making the most of it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: While in Switzerland, ski-goers are not happy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The milder weather results in rainfall, bringing the winter activities at ski resorts to a halt – like this one in Grindelwald.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's not so great, everything is quite wet, but we make the best out of it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Now we're here and there's still a bit of snow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And mild weather increases the risk of avalanches. In Savoie, the recent weather has raised concerns over a possible snowfall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Claude Schneider, a ski patroller and rescue worker in La Plagne, observes the snow cover several times a day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: You should know that fresh light snow in very good condition weighs about 40 to 50 kilos per cubic meter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And at the time of the 1pm reading, it weighed 250 kilos per cubic meter, which is very bad for the risk of avalanches." According to environmentalists, a succession of warmer winters is probably a direct impact from climate change. For those braving the slopes, the extra few layers might not be needed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The long process of reconstruction is underway on the Spanish island of La Palma after a volcanic eruption that lasted almost a hundred days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Bulldozers continue to dig through the solidified lava in the hope of restoring connections as soon as possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: After being acclaimed at the Met in New York, the Guggenheim Museum Bilbao hosts Alice Neel in Spain until February.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Neel is renowned for her freedom and frankness in dealing with sex and her own sexuality as a woman.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Musée de Luxembourg in Paris pays tribute to one of the most mysterious photographers who ever lived. Vivienne Meyer worked as a nanny in New York all her life, spending her

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: time photographing the world around her. Her countless photographs were discovered after her death in 2006.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I'm the Misty Woman.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Zhao Fei's Supernova exhibition is rich, complex, technological and visionary.
